str2: Wretched, afflicted, miserable. From the base of talanton and a derivative of the base of peira; enduring trial, i.e. Miserable.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To rescue, deliver (from danger or destruction).

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.
Death, physical or spiritual. From thnesko; death.
